discourse_list.title: State of The Peg: Week of July 4

content.content: Takeaways:  Peg is low enough to pay attention, but it could recover on its own. Debt ceiling is almost within spitting distance. ETH is probably the culprit, but the lower stability fee appears to increase the sensitivity of the system to price movements.   Price is down  35%20PM2816×1386 320 KB    29%20PM2816×1504 475 KB    49%20PM1854×1320 790 KB   Supply is up.  51%20PM2724×1452 378 KB   Eth is probably the culprit.  20%20PM2830×1496 387 KB   Old loan circulation is down slightly. New loan circulation has slowed back to a steady state.  56%20PM2726×1468 232 KB   Secondary lending supply is up.  36%20PM2762×1514 274 KB   Secondary lending borrow is up.  58%20PM2772×1504 256 KB   Collateralization rose and fell with ETH price, but fell more with ETH than it rose with ETH, so CDP owners probably increased leverage.  41%20PM2720×1444 386 KB
Great to see this analysis on the forum in an easily accessible format. Is the plan to post it here every week in addition to the monetary policy presentation in the governance meeting?
No plan either direction yet, testing things out.
